name: pointillist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a painter who paints in a style developed in France at the end of the 19th century in which small spots of pure colour are used that seem to mix when seen from far away: Seurat and Signac were two of the most famous pointillists. I'd seen several pastel painters use little dots, like the pointillists. See
pointillism
More examplesFewer examplesSeurat was a pointillist who filled his canvas with dots.He applies a mass of detail with a pointillist's brush.Pissarro's late landscapes retain the pointillists' interest in optically mixed color.
